body.p: 1. Eshton’s son, the brother of Beth-rapha and a descendant of Kelub from Judah’s tribe. Paseah was mentioned as one of the men of Recah (1 Chr 4:12).
2. Ancestor of a family of temple servants who returned to Palestine with Zerubbabel after the Babylonian captivity (Ezr 2:49; Neh 7:51).
3. Joiada’s father. Joiada, along with Meshullam, repaired the Old Gate of Jerusalem under Nehemiah’s direction during the postexilic period (Neh 3:6).
